channel.title: Alison Tague
channel.description: Hi, I'm Alison Tague, a full-stack web developer. This is my portfolio with past projects I've worked on and a little bit about me.

item.title: Project 4
item.description: Toy Town is an app I created on Rails. It has full CRUD functionality. Users sign in with Twitter if they would like to create a Wishlist or vote on their favorite toys. This is a website that will be used for a small business in my hometown. You can check out the code here.

item.title: Project 3
item.description: VenuMenu is a collaborative project built on Rails that integrates the Songkick API. Users can log in with Twitter and search a Venue by name. The venues in the US associated with the search criteria will display along with their respective homepages (if available). Users can then comment on their desired venue. My main role in the group was integrating the API. You can visit the app here and check out the code here.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Drizzly integrates the weather underground API into a Rails app. Users sign in and are taken to a page with their current location's weather and ten day forecast. They can search other cities to see the same information and save cities to their favorites for quick access. This app was a two day group effort where my main role was styling. You can visit the app here and check out the code here.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Venyou is a user driven app where users who are not familiar with Boston can post their favorite artists and find venues in the area that match their music preferences through fellow user recommendations. This was my first app built using Sinatra! Check it out here.
